source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶雜事
translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya-kṣudraka-vastu

source_sentence: 卷第七
translation: Vol. 7

source_sentence: 三藏法師義淨奉　制譯
translation: Translation by the Tripiṭaka Master Yijing Feng

source_sentence: 第二門第二子攝頌之餘
translation: the second entry, the second son, contains the rest of the verse

source_sentence: 緣在室羅伐城。
translation: They were in the city of Śrāvastī as a condition.

source_sentence: 六眾苾芻雖復年邁，常為掉舉，諸苾芻告曰：「仁今年暮，掉舉未休。」
translation: Although the six monks were still quite old, they were always provoked, and the monks told them, "Sir, this year is drawing to a close, and I haven't stopped provoking them."

source_sentence: 聞已默然，遂告難陀、鄔波難陀曰：「諸黑鉢者極為多事輒行誡勗，我等宜可作恥辱事令其羞赧。」
translation: After hearing this, they were silent. They then told Nandana and Upananda, "Those black bread winners are so busy that they often admonish us, so we should do something humiliating to make them blush."

source_sentence: 從是作心伺求其便。
translation: They then set their minds to seeking their convenience.

source_sentence: 時有眾多耆宿苾芻，往野林中樹下宴坐。
translation: A large group of senior monks and nuns then went to sit under a tree in a wild forest.

source_sentence: 于時六眾亦往林中，見彼寂定，遂於三面上風放火，遠在一邊遙看而住。
translation: Six members of the crowd also went to the forest at the time, and when they saw their serene concentration, they set fire to the wind on three sides and stayed at a distance watching from one side.

source_sentence: 時彼老宿見火欲至，即皆驚起隨煙走出。
translation: Seeing the fire about to reach them, the elderly monks all startled, got up, and walked out with the smoke.

source_sentence: 六眾見時作如是語：「仁今年老掉舉未休，何故奔馳乖失庠序？」
translation: When the six members of the crowd saw this, they said, "Sir, this year's elder still hasn't stopped behaving, so why are you running around out of order?"

source_sentence: 報言：「具壽！
translation: He replied, "Gosu!

source_sentence: 汝可不見，猛火燒林何怪趨走？」
translation: Don't you see how a fierce fire burns down a forest and why does it make you run away?"

source_sentence: 六眾報曰：「世尊豈可於平居時制其戒法，危險之際便遣犯耶？」
translation: The six groups of people replied, "How could the Bhagavān have established the precepts while they were living in peace and then rejected their violation at a time of danger?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「豈非汝等縱此火災！」
translation: They replied, "Did you not start this fire!"

source_sentence: 六眾大笑：「我等故欲恥辱於汝。」
translation: The six people laughed, "We therefore want to humiliate you."

source_sentence: 苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「苾芻不應焚燒林野。
translation: The monk told the Buddha about this, and he said, "A monk shouldn't burn the forest or fields.

source_sentence: 若故作者，得窣吐羅底也罪。」
translation: If you do so, you'll be guilty of being a stūpa."

source_sentence: 緣在室羅伐城。
translation: The tutor was in the city of Silsāvana.

source_sentence: 有二苾芻老少相隨人間遊履，老者多有衣資，少者三衣而已。
translation: There were two monks, an older man and a younger man, who wandered among the people. The older man had plenty of clothing, and the younger man had only three garments.

source_sentence: 老語少曰：「具壽！
translation: The older man said to the younger, "Gosu!

source_sentence: 汝可為我擎持衣袋，我今疲極暫欲息肩。」
translation: Carry my robe sack for me, for now I'm exhausted and want to rest my shoulders."

source_sentence: 少者報曰：「欲致片言，願不瞋責。」
translation: The young man replied, "I'd like to say a few words, but I hope you won't be angry with me."

source_sentence: 答言：「任說，誰復相瞋？」
translation: He replied, "Tell me what you will, and who will be angry with you?"

source_sentence: 少言：「老宿豈可不見，佛法僧寶隨得奉施，何假多畜愚癡物耶？」
translation: Shao said, "Couldn't an old person see that the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha can be given as they are, so why should he presume to store many foolish things?"

source_sentence: 告言：「賢首！
translation: Tell them, "Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 汝不為持，誰復強逼？
translation: If you don't hold it, who will force it?

source_sentence: 然我問汝：『汝豈是我阿遮利耶、鄔波馱耶，輒於我處而行誡勗？』」
translation: Then I ask you, 'Are you me, Acala or Upādhyāya, who always gives instructions to me?'"

source_sentence: 少者默爾。
translation: The young man was silent.

source_sentence: 老作是念：「我今宜可料理小人。」
translation: The elder thought, "Now, I guess I could take care of the little guy."

source_sentence: 至日云暮共寄寺中，寺內眾僧舊立條制，乃至一宿無依止者不得輒住。
translation: When the sun rose and set, they were both sent to the temple, where the monks had established an old rule that no one could stay overnight without a support.

source_sentence: 其知事人告二客曰：「仁既新來，可請臥具。」
translation: The person in charge of the monks told the two guests, "Since you're new here, you may ask for bedding."

source_sentence: 老者取已語言：「汝可請取。」
translation: After the older man took them, he said, "You may ask for them."

source_sentence: 少者報曰：「我未依止，待得師已，方請臥具。」
translation: The younger one replied, "I don't have a mentor to rely on, so I won't ask for a bed until I have one."

source_sentence: 即便往詣眾首上座，既禮敬已白言：「上座與我依止。」
translation: He then went to the head monk's seat and, after paying homage, said, "The head monk will give me support."

source_sentence: 報言：「賢首！
translation: In return, he said, "Good man!

source_sentence: 汝共誰來？」
translation: Who have you come with?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「苾芻某甲。」
translation: He answered, "That monk."

source_sentence: 「賢首！
translation: "Bhadrapāla!

source_sentence: 汝可就彼請為依止，勿令彼人作如是語：『眾首上座破我門徒。』」
translation: You may ask them to give you support, but don't allow them to say, 'The chief monk refutes my disciples.'"

source_sentence: 彼聞語已更就餘人，如是展轉乃至合寺，隨所至處悉皆不受。
translation: After hearing those words, he went to another person and continued in this way until he joined the temple, rejecting them wherever he went.

source_sentence: 後還房所扣門喚曰：「敬禮上座。」
translation: He then returned to his room, buttoned the door, and called out, "Greetings, Bhadraśri."

source_sentence: 問：「汝是誰？」
translation: He asked, "Who are you?"

source_sentence: 答云：「某甲。」
translation: He replied, "So-and-so."

source_sentence: 「願汝無病。」
translation: "May you not be sick."

source_sentence: 白言：「上座知不？
translation: He said, "Does the superior know?

source_sentence: 此合寺中大眾立制，若無依止一宿不停。
translation: This is a rule established by the general public at the temple, that if there's no support, they won't stop for one night.

source_sentence: 可與我依止。」
translation: You can give me support."

source_sentence: 報言：「賢首！
translation: They replied, "Good man!

source_sentence: 實是好制，眾不作者，我當為立。
translation: 'It's really a good rule, and I will establish it for them if they don't approve of it.'

source_sentence: 汝先語我云：『豈不見三尊多畜愚癡物。』
translation: You first said to me, 'Don't you see that the three honored ones often store foolish things?'

source_sentence: 今言：『敬禮上座。』
translation: Now, you said, 'I respect the ascendant.'

source_sentence: 一何翻覆之甚？
translation: How could it be so mistaken?

source_sentence: 如是逋慢誰能為作？
translation: Who could possibly do such a deceitful act?

source_sentence: 隨汝別覓依止之師。」
translation: Find another teacher to rely on, as you see fit."

source_sentence: 彼遂默然。
translation: He then remained silent.

source_sentence: 不為開戶，通宵坐地受苦至明。
translation: Not opening his door, he sat on the ground all night and suffered until morning.

source_sentence: 苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「不應無依止師人間行李。
translation: The monk told the Buddha about this, and he said, "You shouldn't go without a reliable teacher for human luggage.

source_sentence: 又諸苾芻不同師子懷堅鞕心有恨不捨，然諸僧伽不應輒作如是惡制，令他苾芻橫受苦惱。
translation: Furthermore, if monks and nuns harbor resentment and don't abandon their masters, the saṃgha shouldn't lightly impose such harsh restrictions, causing other monks and nuns to suffer unjustly.

source_sentence: 若苾芻無依止師人間遊行、作惱他心立非法制，皆得越法罪。」
translation: If a monk without a supportive teacher marches among people and creates an unlawful restraint that bothers others, he'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 佛在摩揭陀國人間遊行，於莫俱山薄俱羅藥叉住殿而為安處，苾芻龍護而為侍者。
translation: When the Buddha was traveling among the people of Magadha, he was staying at the Yakṣa temple in Pokhara on Mount Mogu and was accompanied by a monk named Nāgabodhi.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊於闇夜分，天復微雨掣電流光，於空地中經行遊步。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was walking through the open space during the dark part of the night when the sky was again drizzling with lightning and streaming with rays of lightning.

source_sentence: 諸佛常法乃至世尊未臥已來，侍者不應在前而臥。
translation: The constant Dharma of the buddhas goes so far that an attendant shouldn't lie down in front of the Bhagavān before he goes to sleep.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋便以天眼遍觀下界，見佛世尊在薄俱羅藥叉所住之殿，於闇夜分，天復微雨掣電流光，於空地中經行遊步。
translation: Tendai then looked around the lower realms with his divine eye and saw the Bhagavān walking through the open space in the hall where Pokkhula Yakṣa was staying during the dark part of the night as the heavens again drizzled with lightning and streamed with lightning.

source_sentence: 「我今宜可禮覲世尊。」
translation: "Now, I would like to pay my respects to the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 即便變作妙琉璃殿，隨身而往上覆世尊，隨大師後而為遊步。
translation: He then transformed himself into a marvelous beryl palace, carried it up to cover the Bhagavān, and wandered behind him.

source_sentence: 摩揭陀國時俗諸人若見孩兒夜啼泣者，告言：「勿啼！
translation: If ordinary people in Magadha saw a child crying at night, they told him, "Don't cry!

source_sentence: 薄俱羅藥叉欲來食汝。」
translation: The Pokkhula Yakṣas want to come and eat you."

source_sentence: 于時龍護見佛世尊，夜深不臥久作經行：「我今宜可道薄俱羅藥叉而為恐怖。」
translation: Seeing the Bhagavān, Nāgârjuna didn't lie down late at night and took a long walk through the sutras, "Now would it be better for me to fear the path of the Pokkharasvara yakṣas?"

source_sentence: 作是念已即披長毛大緂，於經行處告言：「沙門！
translation: After he thought this, he put on a long-haired bundle of hair and went to his place of meditation and told him, "Ascetic!

source_sentence: 薄俱羅藥叉現身來至。」
translation: The bhagavān came in the form of a buddha."

source_sentence: 佛告龍護：「汝愚癡人！
translation: The Buddha told Nāgârjuna, "You foolish man!

source_sentence: 以薄俱羅藥叉怖於善逝，如來、世尊、應、正等覺久離怖畏，毛竪心驚亦皆除遣。」
translation: Because the Vajra Yakṣa was afraid of Sugata, the Tathāgata, the Bhagavān, the Worthy One, and the Perfectly Enlightened One have long been free of fear, and their hair standing straight up and their minds being frightened are all removed."

source_sentence: 時天帝釋見彼龍護作非法事，心生嫌怪，白言：「世尊！
translation: Seeing that dragon protector doing something illegal, Indra became disgusted and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 於佛法中亦有如是等人？」
translation: Is there such a person among the Buddhadharmas?"

source_sentence: 佛告帝釋：「汝今應知！
translation: The Buddha told Tīrṣa, "Now you should know!

source_sentence: 喬答摩家極甚寬廣，於中品類乃有多途。
translation: The Gautama family is extremely broad, and there are many different kinds of people in it.

source_sentence: 勿輕此人，亦於來世獲清淨法。」
translation: Don't despise this person; he'll also attain purity in the next life."

source_sentence: 時天帝釋禮佛足已便往天宮。
translation: After bowing his head to the Buddha's feet, Śakra then departed for the heavenly palace.

source_sentence: 佛作是念：「由諸苾芻以毛向外而披大緂，有斯過失。
translation: The Buddha had this thought, "This is a mistake for those monks to wear large robes with their hair facing outward.

source_sentence: 我今制諸苾芻如是披者得越法罪。」
translation: Now, I've made it a rule for monks to wear them this way, for they'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻聞是制已，隨逐商旅人間遊行，至牧牛人處，時屬寒夜得長毛緂，緂有臭氣兼多蟣蝨，意欲將毛向外而覆，彼懼犯戒不敢翻披。
translation: After hearing this restriction, those monks followed a caravan of travelers through the streets and went to a cowherd. During the cold night, they obtained a long, woolly garment that smelled like dirt and was full of lice, and they wanted to cover it with hair outward.

source_sentence: 苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「毛向外披，但得端坐不合經行。
translation: The monk told the Buddha about this, and he said, "When you cover your hair outward, you can only sit correctly and not practice the sūtras.

source_sentence: 違者得越法罪。」
translation: A person who disobeys this will be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 第二門第三子攝頌曰：　披緂聽不聽、　　惡地不置鉢、　衣開三種紐、　　應知絛亦三。
translation: The second disciple, the third son, recites this verse: "Do you listen to him when he wears a cloth, don't listen to him when he puts his bowl on a bad ground, open his robe with three kinds of ties, and know that he has also worn three.

source_sentence: 緣在室羅伐城，佛告諸苾芻：「若得劫貝臥帔、或得長毛緂、或得高襵婆，如是等物我今聽許。
translation: It was in the city of Śrāvastī that the Buddha addressed the monks, "Now, I'll accept such things as a karpāsa cape, a long-haired veil, or a high-sleeved skirt.

source_sentence: 若僧伽若別人皆隨意受用，若是勝上高襵婆緂，僧伽聽畜，不許別人。」
translation: If the saṃgha or anyone else takes them as they like, the saṃgha will listen to them and won't allow anyone else to take them."

source_sentence: 緣在室羅伐城。
translation: The story is set in the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時有乞食苾芻，於日初分執持衣鉢入城乞食，上衣墮落，即便疾疾置鉢于地整理上衣。
translation: A monk begging for food entered the city at the beginning of the day with his robe and bowl, and when his upper robe fell off, he quickly put his bowl on the ground and straightened his upper robe.

source_sentence: 時居士婆羅門見已生嫌，作如是語：「沙門釋子多不潔淨，隨穢惡地而置其鉢。」
translation: When the householder Brāhmaṇa saw this, he became disgusted and said, "Many ascetics and Śākyamunis are impure and place their bowls on filthy ground."

source_sentence: 苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「不應隨地而置其鉢，得越法罪；然為護衣應安拘紐。」
translation: The monk told the Buddha about this, and he said, "You shouldn't put your bowl on the ground afterwards, for it would be a transgression; but you should put it in a kunu to protect your robe."

source_sentence: 苾芻便以棘針綴衣，致令衣損，佛言：「不應爾。」
translation: The monk then wrapped a thorn in his robe, causing it to become damaged, and the Buddha said, "That shouldn't be the case."

source_sentence: 復以線繫，佛言：「此亦不應，可於肩上安拘胸前綴紐。」
translation: Again, he tied it with a thread, and the Buddha said, 'Neither should I. You can put a button on your shoulder and put it in front of your chest.'"

source_sentence: 苾芻不知云何作紐？
translation: The monk didn't know how to make a button.

source_sentence: 佛言：「紐有三種：一、如蘡薁子，二、如葵子，三、如棠梨子。」
translation: The Buddha said, "There are three kinds of newts: 1. like the seed of azulene, 2. like the seed of anemones, and 3. like the seed of a pear."

source_sentence: 彼於肩上緣邊安拘，能令速斷，「應於緣後四指安拘。」
translation: They place a cloth around the edge of the shoulder that quickly breaks, saying, "You should place a cloth behind the edge of the four fingers."

source_sentence: 即於衣上綴拘，令衣疾破，佛言：「應重作帖以錐鑽穴，拘出其內繫作雙拘，其紐可在胸前緣邊綴之，疊衣三襵是安拘紐處。
translation: That is, attaching a restraint to the robe, so that the robe quickly breaks, the Buddha said, "Should be re-made post to drill a hole with an awl, restrain it and tie it inside for a double restraint, the restraint can be attached to the front edge of the chest, fold the robe three times and the bowls are the place to attach the restraint.

source_sentence: 若違制者得越法罪。」
translation: If you violate this rule, you'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 緣在室羅伐城同前。
translation: The conditions in Śrāvastī are the same as those described above.

source_sentence: 乞食苾芻乞食之時下衣墮落，置鉢于地整理下裙，俗人見嫌作如是語：「沙門釋子不簡淨穢，隨在何地而置其鉢。」
translation: When a monk begging for food falls out of his undergarment and puts his bowl on the ground to adjust his underskirt, a layperson who sees this says, "The ascetic or Śākyamuni doesn't keep his bowl clean, so he puts it wherever he goes."

source_sentence: 苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「應繫下裙方入聚落。」
translation: The monk told the Buddha about this, and he said, "You should tie up your undergarment before entering the village."

source_sentence: 彼以繩繫令衣速破，佛言：「勿以繩繫，應用腰絛。」
translation: Tying it with a rope makes the robe quickly break, but the Buddha says, 'Don't tie it with a rope; use the waistband.'"

source_sentence: 苾芻不知其絛如何當作，佛言：「絛有三種：一、偏，二、方，三、圓。
translation: When the monk didn't know how to fit his waistband, the Buddha said, "There are three kinds of waistbands: 1. partial, 2. square, and 3. round.

source_sentence: 若異此者，得越法罪。」
translation: If someone differs from these, they'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 第二門第四子攝頌曰：　勝鬘惡生事、　　次制諸瓔珞、　金絛及彩物、　　斯皆畜不應。
translation: The second gate, the fourth son, gathered the verse, saying, "The Śrīmālādevī is a terrible troublemaker, next makes jewelry, and gold tapestries and colored things, but these should not be kept as animals.

source_sentence: 佛在劫比羅城多根樹園。
translation: The Buddha was staying at the Durgon Grove in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 爾時釋子大名有一聚落，其知營務人忽然命過。
translation: At the time, there was a village of Śākyamuni the Great Name, and the person who knew how to work there suddenly lost his life.

source_sentence: 時彼眾人來白大名曰：「知事之人今已身死，可遣餘人來知村務。」
translation: A group of people then came to the great name and said, "Now that the person who knew the duties has died, perhaps we could send another person to know the village's duties."

source_sentence: 時有一摩納婆在傍而立，大名告曰：「摩納婆！
translation: There was a manaḍva standing nearby, and the daimyo told them, "Manaḍva!

source_sentence: 汝今且往撿挍村事，我當續更遣知事人。」
translation: Now, go and examine the village's affairs, and I'll send another person who knows about them."

source_sentence: 彼便即去往至村中依法撿察，所得地利送上大名，倍勝於前人無恨色。
translation: They then went and inspected the village according to the law, and the amount of land they had obtained was presented to the Mahānāman, who was twice as good as the person before him and didn't look hateful.

source_sentence: 大名問曰：「汝今多送租稅倍勝常時，不於眾人生逼迫不？」
translation: The daimyo asked, "Now, have you given away more rent than usual, and won't you be a persecutor to the people?"

source_sentence: 白言：「大家！
translation: Bai Yan: "Everyone!

source_sentence: 我並依理而稅，不苦於人。」
translation: I also tax people according to reason, so I don't suffer them."

source_sentence: 于時大名問村人曰：「此摩納婆不於村邑生逼迫耶？」
translation: The Mahānāman then asked the villagers, "Does this manabha not cause persecution in the village?"

source_sentence: 諸人答曰：「人無恨心。」
translation: The people replied, "People don't have hatred."

source_sentence: 于時大名遂立為主。
translation: The daimyo then established themselves as lords.

source_sentence: 其人平均依理徵稅不為抑奪，為知事官統領村邑。
translation: He collected taxes according to the rules and didn't suppress them, and he became a governor over the village.

source_sentence: 時摩納婆於大婆羅門族娶女為妻，未久之間便誕一息。
translation: It was then that Manabha took a woman as his wife from the great Brahman clan, and before long she gave birth to a child.

source_sentence: 復經年月又生一女，名為明月，如法長養漸至成人，智慧聰明儀容超絕，於諸村邑無不歎美。
translation: She was raised according to the rules and gradually grew to adulthood, and her wisdom, intelligence, and appearance were so outstanding that she was praised by everyone in the village.

source_sentence: 後於異時其父得病，雖加藥餌竟不瘳損，於此邑中所收年稅，咸充藥直無有殘餘。
translation: At some point later, his father became ill, and even though he was given medicine and beverages, he wasn't healed.

source_sentence: 更向外村轉貸而用，其病日篤遂致命終。
translation: He went on to borrow money from another village and used it, but his illness became increasingly serious and he died.

source_sentence: 時村邑人詣大名所，白言：「大家！
translation: The people of the village then went to the daimyo and said, "Great man!

source_sentence: 彼知事官今已身死。」
translation: The officer in charge of that village is now dead."

source_sentence: 大名告曰：「於彼村邑有年稅不？」
translation: The daimyo told him, "Is there an annual tax in that town?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「於此年中多獲封稅，由彼遭病咸充藥直，仍不能足更貸餘村。」
translation: He answered, "During this year, I was able to collect a lot of taxes, and since I've been sick, I've been able to fill my prescriptions, but I still don't have enough to lend to the rest of the village."

source_sentence: 大名告曰：「所有殘餘可為還債。」
translation: The daimyo told them, "Whatever's left over can be used to repay the debt."

source_sentence: 諸人答曰：「更無餘物。
translation: The people replied, "There's nothing left.

source_sentence: 唯有一婦及男女二人，女名明月智識聰明儀容超絕，於諸村邑無不歎美。」
translation: There's just a woman and a man and woman named Luna whose intelligence, knowledge, and intelligence are so extraordinary that they're admired by everyone in the village."

source_sentence: 大名告曰：「母及於兒任其自活，其女明月可喚將來。」
translation: The great man told them, "Let the mother and child live on their own, and the daughter, Bright Moon, can be summoned to the future."

source_sentence: 時彼邑人放其母子，遂將明月至大名所。
translation: The people of that town then released their mother and son, and they took Bright Moon to the daimyo's residence.

source_sentence: 時彼宅中有一老母常為二事：一、煮餅食，二、採眾花。
translation: At the time, there was an elderly mother in that house who always did two things: one, cooked bread for food, and two, gathered many flowers.

source_sentence: 于時老母白大名曰：「我今年邁不堪二業，此之小女與我為伴。」
translation: The old woman then said to the daimyo, "I'm too old for two kinds of work; this little girl will be my companion."

source_sentence: 彼言：「隨意。」
translation: He said, "As you wish."

source_sentence: 老母即報明月：「汝今可往林內採花，我在家中營事餅食。」
translation: The old mother then reported to Luna, "Now, you can go into the forest and gather flowers while I work at home making cookies and eating them."

source_sentence: 彼採花已線結好鬘奉上大名，大名見喜告曰：「勝妙花鬘可置而去。」
translation: After he picked the flowers, he tied a garland of thread and presented it to the eldest monk, who was delighted to see it and told him, "The garland of wonderful flowers can be placed away."

source_sentence: 喚老母來問言：「何意先時花少，今者倍多？」
translation: He summoned the elderly mother and asked her, "Why were there so few flowers in the past and twice as many now?"

source_sentence: 白言：「先時大家有近親人來從我乞，我即分布，今時不與。
translation: She said, "In the past, people close to me begged from me, and I distributed them; now, I won't give them to them.

source_sentence: 又我目暗觀察不審，今小女眼明採花審諦是故花多。」
translation: Also, my eyes were dark, and I didn't examine them, but now my daughter's eyes are clear, and she picks flowers with a clear understanding.

source_sentence: 大名曰：「若爾，此女留住園中，每於日日常採多花，結作勝鬘持來與我。」
translation: The great name said, "If that's the case, then this woman stays in the garden and every day she picks lots of flowers, wraps them up in a garland of flowers, and brings them to me."

source_sentence: 因號此女名曰勝鬘。
translation: He therefore called that woman's name, 'Śrīmālā.'

source_sentence: 女於後時，取己食分詣彼園所，遇佛世尊入城乞食。
translation: At some point later, the woman took some of her own food and went to the garden where she met the Bhagavān entering the city to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 勝鬘於路見佛色相，深起敬心瞻視尊顏，渴仰而住便作是念：「由我昔來於真福田未曾供養，是故我今獲斯貧賤。
translation: Seeing the Buddha's appearance on the road, she deeply respected him, looked at his face, longed for him, and thought, "Because I never made offerings in the past to the truly blessed fields, I've now become so poor.

source_sentence: 若佛世尊受我食者，我此飯食持將奉施。」
translation: If the Bhagavān accepts my food, I'll keep this meal and give it to him."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼女心，即便舒鉢告言：「善女！
translation: Knowing that woman's mind, the Bhagavān then even took his bowl and told her, "Good girl!

source_sentence: 如汝所念，欲施食者可置鉢中。」
translation: As you think, those of you who want to give food may put it in your bowl."

source_sentence: 于時勝鬘將己飯食，以恭敬心置佛鉢內，頂禮佛足作如是言：「願我此福得捨婢身，永離貧苦獲大富貴。」
translation: Śrīmālā then placed her own food in the Buddha's bowl with respect, bowed her head at the Buddha's feet, and said, "May this merit allow me to abandon my handmaid's body and attain great wealth and prosperity by permanently escaping poverty."

source_sentence: 作是願已禮佛而去。
translation: After making this vow, he paid homage to the Buddha and departed.

source_sentence: 在路忽逢父之朋友，彼人善相，既見勝鬘身有異相，問曰：「汝欲何之？」
translation: On the way, he suddenly met a friend of his father's who was good at facial expressions. Seeing that Śrīmālā's body had a different appearance, he asked, "What do you want?"

source_sentence: 勝鬘啼泣，又問：「何故憂懷若斯？」
translation: Śrīmālā wept and asked, "Why are you so sad and troubled?"

source_sentence: 答言：「阿父！
translation: He replied, "Father!

source_sentence: 我被大名將充婢使。」
translation: I've been made a servant by a great commander."

source_sentence: 告言：「小女可舒手來，我與汝相。」
translation: He told her, "Young lady, you may extend your hand, and I'll show you my features."

source_sentence: 彼便展手，老人見已即說頌曰：「若人於手中，　　有鬘鉤輪相；　雖生下賤室，　　當作大王妃。
translation: She then extended her hand, and when the old man saw it, he spoke a verse, "Suppose someone has the shape of a garland and a hooked wheel in their hand; even though they were born in a lowly house, they would be the princess of a great king.

source_sentence: 若人於手中，　　有城樓閣相；　雖生下賤室，　　當作大王妃。
translation: If someone has the shape of a castle in their hand, even though they've been born in a lowly house, they will be the princess of a great king.

source_sentence: 若人口如池，　　聲作鵝王響；　雖生下賤室，　　當作大王妃。
translation: If their mouth is like a pond, and their voice is like the sound of a king goose, even though they've been born in a humble abode, they will become the princess of the great king.

source_sentence: 汝今勿憂愁，　　定離於婢使；　必受上富貴，　　當作大王妃。」
translation: Don't be sad now; you must leave your servant's messenger; you will surely attain great wealth and prosperity and will become the princess of the great king."

source_sentence: 于時勝鬘拜辭老父，行詣園中。
translation: Śrīmālā then paid her respects to her elderly father and went out into the garden.

source_sentence: 乃於後時彼勝光王嚴駕四兵出行遊獵，其所乘馬忽爾奔馳控制不禁，遂至劫比羅國入大名園內。
translation: It was then that King Vairocana, who was traveling with his four armies, suddenly ran off on a horse that couldn't be controlled and reached the country of Kapilavastu and entered the famous park.

source_sentence: 勝鬘見已便作是言：「善來大王！」
translation: Seeing this, Śrīmālā then said, "Good, great king!"

source_sentence: 王問勝鬘：「此是誰園？」
translation: The king asked Śrīmālā, "Whose garden is this?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「是大名園。」
translation: He replied, "This is the garden of great renown."

source_sentence: 王乃下馬，女將繫樹，王言：「取水，我欲洗足。」
translation: The king then dismounted his horse, and when the woman was about to tie it to a tree, the king said, "Get some water, for I want to wash my feet."

source_sentence: 女作是念：「可求煖水，為王洗足。」
translation: The woman thought, "Perhaps I could fetch warm water to wash the king's feet."

source_sentence: 遂即往取日照之水，盛以蓮葉將至王所與王洗足。
translation: She then went and got some water from Sunburst, filled it with lotus leaves, and brought it to the king to wash his feet.

source_sentence: 王復告言：「更可取水，我須洗面。」
translation: The king then again said, "Perhaps you could fetch some more water, for I need to wash my face."

source_sentence: 女又作念：「溫煖之水洗目非宜。」
translation: The woman then had another thought, "Warm and warm water isn't appropriate for washing your eyes."

source_sentence: 以手攪水令冷煖相得，送至王所。
translation: She stirred the water with her hands, making it both warm and cold, and took it to the king.

source_sentence: 王洗面已復語女言：「更取水來，我欲須飲。」
translation: After he washed his face, the king then said to the woman, "Get some more water, for I want to drink."

source_sentence: 女還作念：「要得冷水可能止渴。」
translation: The woman then repeatedly thought, "I need cold water to quench my thirst."

source_sentence: 即詣池所深撥取水奉上於王。
translation: She then went to the pond, drew water from its depths, and offered it to the king.

source_sentence: 王既飲已即問女言：「於此園中有三種水耶？」
translation: After he had drunk, the king then asked the woman, "Are there three kinds of water in this garden?"

source_sentence: 答言：「園無三水，本是一處。」
translation: He replied, "There are no three waters in the garden; it's originally one place."

source_sentence: 王復問言：「若是一水，汝向如何得三種別？」
translation: The king then asked, "If it's one water, how did you get the three kinds of distinctions?"

source_sentence: 如前所作具白於王。
translation: He explained everything that he had done to the king as before.

source_sentence: 王聞此語便即思惟：「此女方便善解時機。」
translation: Hearing this, the king then thought, "This woman is skillful in understanding the opportunities of the time."

source_sentence: 作是念已乃告女言：「我欲眠臥，須汝握脚。」
translation: After he thought this, he then told the woman, "I want to sleep and lie down, so I need you to hold my feet."

source_sentence: 王既臥已女為握足，王便得睡。
translation: After the king lay down, the woman held his feet for him, and the king was able to sleep.

source_sentence: 女復念言：「諸王貴勝，怨恨者多、相憂者少。
translation: The woman then thought, "Kings are noble and superior, and there are many people who resent them and few who are concerned about them.

source_sentence: 王今眠睡恐有惡人來相侵害，若不為王關閉門戶，忽有傷損，我及曹主必招罪責，事須防守。」
translation: Now that the king is sleeping, I'm afraid some bad person will come and attack him. If I don't close the door for the king, and if there's any injury or damage, the lord of Cao and I will surely be blamed, so I must guard against it."

source_sentence: 即關門戶。
translation: He then closed the gates.

source_sentence: 于時四兵尋覓大王到其園所，問言：「王在此耶？」
translation: Four soldiers then searched for the king and found him in his garden and asked, "Is the king here?"

source_sentence: 女聞語已不為開門，軍聲外震王乃驚覺，即問女言：「此是何響？」
translation: When the woman heard what she said, she didn't open the door, but the sound of an army shaking outside startled the king, who then asked the woman, "What was that noise?"

source_sentence: 女曰：「有諸人來問王所在，欲得開門。」
translation: The woman said, "There are people who come to ask where the king is and want to open the door."

source_sentence: 王乃問女：「誰閉其門？」
translation: The king then asked the woman, "Who closed the door?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我閉。」
translation: He replied, "I'm shutting up."

source_sentence: 「何故閉耶？」
translation: "Why are you shutting up?"

source_sentence: 女曰：「我自思念：『諸王貴勝，怨恨者多、相憂者少。
translation: The woman said, "I myself thought, 'Kings are noble and powerful, and there are many who resent them but few who grieve for them.

source_sentence: 王今睡眠，恐有惡人來相侵害，若不為王關閉門戶，忽有傷損，我及曹主俱招罪責。』
translation: Now that the king is asleep, I'm afraid some bad person will come and attack him. If I don't close the door for the king, and if there's any injury or damage, both I and Lord Cao will be blamed.'

source_sentence: 因即關閉。」
translation: So he immediately closed it."

source_sentence: 王聞此說讚言：「好女！
translation: Hearing this, the king praised her, saying, "Good girl!

source_sentence: 甚有奇計。」
translation: There's a wonderful plan."

source_sentence: 王曰：「園主大名是汝何親？」
translation: The king said, "Which of you is the park owner's great name?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我是大名驅使之人。」
translation: He replied, "I'm a person driven by a great name."

source_sentence: 王語女言：「汝非在下，是大名女何不實說？」
translation: The king said to the woman, "Why don't you tell the truth if you're not here, or if you're a woman of great renown?"

source_sentence: 女乃默然。
translation: The woman then remained silent.

source_sentence: 時王語女：「可往城中報大名曰：『勝光大王在汝園內。』」
translation: The king then said to the woman, "You may go to the city and report to the great commander, 'The great king Vairocana is in your garden.'"

source_sentence: 女即速去具報大名，大名聞已辦諸美饍及以香花，與多人眾詣其園所，見勝光王唱言：「善來大王！」
translation: The woman then quickly went and reported it to the daimyo. When the daimyo heard this, he prepared a delicious meal and flowers, went to his garden with a large crowd, and said to King Vairocana, "Good coming, Great King!"

source_sentence: 共相慰問，令王洗浴，次奉上衣塗飾香鬘，具薦芳饌。
translation: They exchanged greetings, had the king wash himself, then presented him with an upper robe decorated with fragrant garlands and offered him a delicious meal.

source_sentence: 食罷言議，問大名曰：「此之少女是汝何親？」
translation: When he finished eating, he asked the daimyo, "Which of these young women is your relative?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「是驅使人。」
translation: He answered, "It's a messenger."

source_sentence: 王曰：「非驅使人，是君之女，宜當與我。」
translation: The king said, "She's not a messenger; she's the ruler's daughter, so she should be given to me."

source_sentence: 大名曰：「更有奇妙釋種之女，勝斯數倍，何不取之？」
translation: The daimyo said, "There's a wonderful daughter of the Śākya lineage that's several times better than this, so why don't you take her?"

source_sentence: 王曰：「此女是我所須，不求餘者。」
translation: The king said, "This woman is necessary for me; I won't ask for another."

source_sentence: 大名曰：「若如是者，我當莊嚴備禮奉送。」
translation: The daimyo said, "If that's the case, I'll present her with decorations and prostrations."

source_sentence: 王曰：「善哉！」
translation: The king said, "Good!"

source_sentence: 大名即便嚴飾城隍掃灑衢路，其勝鬘女具諸瓔珞，載于大象，於康莊處，搖鈴遍告劫比羅城所有人眾，或有諸方來集會者：「應知釋種大名之女號曰勝鬘，今欲送與憍薩羅國勝光大王為第一夫人。」
translation: Even as the great celebrity adorned the city god and swept the streets, the Śrīmālā woman, fully ornamented with jewelry and carried on a large elephant, rang a bell and told everyone in Kapilavastu that there might be people from different directions who had come to assemble, "You should know that the Śākyamālā woman of great renown is called Śrīmālā and now she wants to give her name to the great king Śrīmālā of Kośala as first wife."

source_sentence: 舉城人眾咸皆送出。
translation: All the people of the city sent her away.

source_sentence: 時勝光王廣備軍儀禮迎歸國。
translation: The King of Vairocana then prepared an army of soldiers to welcome her back to his country.

source_sentence: 是時王母聞說取婢以作夫人，便懷忿心作如是念：「此非善子，徒煩我腹。
translation: When the king's mother heard that she had taken a maidservant to be her wife, she became angry and thought, "This is not a good son; it's a waste of time to trouble my belly.

source_sentence: 生長成立，終為婢夫。」
translation: He'll grow up and be established, and then he'll end up as a maidservant."

source_sentence: 作是念已懷憂而住。
translation: After that thought, she stayed with sadness in her heart.

source_sentence: 及迎至城，王告勝鬘曰：「汝今可去拜謁大家。」
translation: When he arrived in the city, the king told Śrīmālā, "Now, you may go and pay your respects to the great house."

source_sentence: 勝鬘即便往大家所，手執雙足低頭而拜，其手細軟觸彼母時，身心泰然即便睡著，須臾覺已作如是語：「觀斯婢女身形美觸，必當喪我憍薩羅城。」
translation: Śrīmālā then went to that great house, put her hands on her feet, bowed her head, and worshipped her mother. When her hands were fine and soft and she touched her, she fell asleep with a peaceful body and mind.

source_sentence: 時勝光王有二大夫人：一名行雨、二曰勝鬘。
translation: At the time, King Jōkō had two great wives: one was Hōyū and the other was Śrīmālā.

source_sentence: 若王每與勝鬘歡會聚時，即讚行雨作如是言：「勝鬘當知，行雨夫人容儀超絕。」
translation: Whenever the king gathered with Śrīmālā, he would praise Hōsō and say, "Śrīmālā, you should know that Mrs. Hōsō's appearance is quite extraordinary."

source_sentence: 勝鬘白王：「我於何時可得相見？」
translation: The Śrīmālā said to the king, "When will I be able to meet her?"

source_sentence: 王言：「不久即應相見。」
translation: The king said, "We'll see each other soon."

source_sentence: 若與行雨聚集之時，即讚勝鬘作如是言：「行雨當知，勝鬘夫人肌膚細滑舉世希奇。」
translation: When they gathered together, he praised Prajñāpāramitā and said, "Prajñāpāramitā, you should know that the beautiful woman Prajñāpāramitā has a fine, smooth skin that's truly rare in the world."

source_sentence: 行雨白王：「我於何時可得相見？」
translation: The rain of activity said to the king, "When will I be able to meet her?"

source_sentence: 王言：「不久令汝得見。」
translation: The king said, "It won't be long before you'll be able to see them."

source_sentence: 王於彼二更相稱讚，令生愛重樂欲相見。
translation: The king praised them twice, causing them to become fond of and long to see each other.

source_sentence: 後於異時三春屆節百卉敷榮，茂林清池花鳥交映，孔雀鸚鵡鵝鴈鴛鴦，雜類哀鳴群飛合響。
translation: At some point later, during the three seasons of spring, a hundred flowers bloomed, and flowers and birds mingled in the lush forests and clear ponds, while peacocks, parrots, geese, and birds flew together in a mingling mass of various species.

source_sentence: 王於一時與諸婇女於芳園所，隨處周旋歡娛嬉戲，王息眠睡宮人縱逸，貪諸花果恣意遊行。
translation: At one point, the king and his daughters were roaming around in the fragrant park, enjoying themselves, and the king took a break from sleeping and sleeping to let his palace people roam at will, craving flowers and fruits.

source_sentence: 其時行雨身體勞倦，攀無憂樹枝暫時佇立。
translation: He was physically exhausted from the rain and travel, so he climbed a branch of a tree without sorrow and stood there for a moment.

source_sentence: 勝鬘因過到其傍邊，既見行雨作如是念：「此是樹神。」
translation: As a result, Śrīmālā went by and saw Hōsū, she thought, "This is the tree god."

source_sentence: 即禮其足，勝鬘觸著行雨便睡，王既睡覺遙見勝鬘在行雨處，王即喚諸婇女還入宮中。
translation: He saluted his feet, and when she touched Xing Yu, she fell asleep. After the king fell asleep, he saw her in Xing Yu's place from a distance, and he summoned his women to return to the palace.

source_sentence: 後於異時王對行雨讚勝鬘時，行雨白言：「我於何時得見勝鬘？」
translation: When the king later praised Śrīmālā to the rain of activity, the rain of activity said, "When did I get to see Śrīmālā?"

source_sentence: 王言：「汝已見竟。」
translation: The king said, "You've seen it all."

source_sentence: 行雨答言：「未曾省見。」
translation: Xing Yu replied, "I haven't seen it yet."

source_sentence: 王言：「我令汝憶曾相見時，汝自思念往於園中，手攀無憂樹枝暫時立住，時勝鬘來見手觸汝足。」
translation: The king said, "When I asked you to remember that you had seen each other before, you thought to yourself that you had gone out into the garden, climbed a branch of the tree without sorrow with your hand, and stood there temporarily when the Śrīmālā came to see you and touched your feet with her hand."

source_sentence: 行雨白言：「彼是勝鬘耶？」
translation: Hayagrī replied, "Is that the Śrīmālā?"

source_sentence: 王言：「是。」
translation: The king said, "Yes."

source_sentence: 行雨白言：「知王於我深有愛念，能棄如此細軟容儀曲親於我。」
translation: Xing Yu said, "I know the king is deeply fond of me, and he's able to abandon such delicate ways and bend over backwards to me."

source_sentence: 王復詣彼勝鬘之處讚歎行雨，勝鬘曰：「我於何時得見行雨？」
translation: The king then went back to Prajñāpāramitā and praised Hōryū. Prajñāpāramitā said, "When did I get to see Hōryū?"

source_sentence: 王言：「汝已曾見。」
translation: The king said, "You've seen it before."

source_sentence: 勝鬘言：「我不曾見。」
translation: Śrīmālā said, "I haven't seen it before."

source_sentence: 王言：「我令汝憶，汝於無憂樹下禮行雨足。」
translation: The king said, "I want you to remember that you were prostrating under the tree of no sorrow at the feet of the walking rain."

source_sentence: 勝鬘白王：「彼是行雨耶？」
translation: The Śrīmālā said to the king, "Is that the processional rain?"

source_sentence: 王言：「是。」
translation: The king said, "Yes."

source_sentence: 即白王曰：「知王於我深有愛念，能棄如此顏容色相曲親於我。」
translation: He then said to the king, "I know the king is deeply fond of me and can abandon such a countenance and appearance to bend to me."

source_sentence: 舉國人眾普皆知聞，勝光大王有二夫人：一是勝鬘、一是行雨，勝鬘軟滑超絕諸人，行雨容儀難可比類。
translation: Everyone in the kingdom knew and heard that the great king Vairocana had two wives: one was Vairocana and the other was Hōryū. Vairocana's softness and smoothness transcended those of others, and Hōryū's appearance was hardly comparable.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻咸皆有疑，請世尊曰：「大德！
translation: The monks then all had doubts and asked the Bhagavān, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 勝鬘、行雨各作何業，由其業力，一則身形細軟，二乃容貌超倫？」
translation: What actions did Śrīmālā and Hayagrī do that caused their bodies to be small and tender on the one hand and their appearance to be superb on the other?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「此二皆由自業所感增長成熟，廣說如餘。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "These two things are ripened by the growth of what's caused by one's own actions, as explained in detail here.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 過去世時，於大城中有婆羅門，娶妻未久便誕一息，不經多年復生一女，俱漸長大，父母遇病皆悉身亡。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a Brāhmaṇa in a large city who had married a woman and had given birth to a daughter not long before she grew up, and his parents both died of illness.

source_sentence: 時彼童子既遭憂慼，念往山林即携其妹，共至林所採拾花果以自支持。
translation: When he was overcome by grief, the boy took his sister with him to a mountain grove and gathered flowers and fruit there to support himself.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 如大黑蛇有五過患。
translation: "Like a large black snake, there are five faults.

source_sentence: 云何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者多瞋；二者多恨；三者作惡；四者無恩；五者利毒。
translation: One has much anger, two have much hatred, three do evil, four lack kindness, and five are venomous in their benefits.

source_sentence: 應知女人亦有五過：一者多瞋；二者多恨；三者作惡；四者無恩；五者利毒。
translation: You should know that women also have five faults: one, much anger; two, much hate; three, doing evil; four, lacking kindness; and five, being venomous in benefits.

source_sentence: 云何名為女人利毒？
translation: What's called the woman's beneficial poison?

source_sentence: 凡諸女人多懷猛利染欲之心。
translation: Ordinary women often harbor violent, defiled desires.

source_sentence: 是時童女既至成人，欲心漸盛告其兄曰：『我今不能常飡花果以自存命，可往人間求諸飲食。』
translation: When she reached adulthood, she became increasingly desirous and told her brother, 'Now, I can't eat flowers and fruits on a regular basis to save my life, so I could go to the human world and ask for food and drink.'

source_sentence: 時兄將妹共出山林，往婆羅門家而行乞食，兩聲齊喚。
translation: The elder brother then took his sister out of the forest and went to the Brāhmaṇa's house to solicit alms, calling out to her with two voices.

source_sentence: 主人出看見而告曰：『隱居之人亦畜妻室。』
translation: The host came out to see them and told them, 'That man who lives in seclusion also has a wife and a home.'

source_sentence: 兄曰：『此非我妻，是親妹也。』
translation: The brother said, 'That's not my wife, but my sister.'

source_sentence: 即問兄曰：『曾娉人未？』
translation: He then asked his brother, 'Has he ever had a wife?'

source_sentence: 報言：『未。』
translation: They replied, 'No.'

source_sentence: 『若如是者，何不與我？』
translation: 'If that's the case, why don't you give it to me?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『此已遠離世間惡法。』
translation: She replied, 'This is far removed from the bad worldly dharmas.'

source_sentence: 女心欲盛報其兄曰：『豈我林中食諸花果不能活耶？
translation: The woman's desire to prosper rewarded her brother, saying, 'Couldn't I have lived while eating the flowers and fruits in the forest?'

source_sentence: 然我不堪煩惱所逼，共辭林野遠至人間，今可以我與婆羅門。』
translation: Still, I couldn't bear the thought of being forced by affliction to leave the forest and wilderness together and go far away to the human realm, so now I can be married to a brāhmaṇa.'

source_sentence: 兄曰：『我實不能嫁娶於汝，此是惡法，非我所為。
translation: My brother said, 'I really can't marry you; it's a bad law, and it's not mine.

source_sentence: 汝有俗心，任情所作。』
translation: You have a worldly mind and are free to do as you please.'

source_sentence: 時婆羅門知女心已，延入家中大會宗親，納以為婦，報其兄曰：『今可與我同宅而居，別為一室。』
translation: Knowing the woman's thoughts, the brāhmaṇa invited her into his home, assembled his clanmates, and accepted her as his wife. He told his brother, 'Now, you can live with me in the same house or in a separate dwelling.'

source_sentence: 兄曰：『我不求欲，當樂出家。』
translation: The brother said, 'I don't seek desire; I'll happily leave home.'

source_sentence: 妹曰：『共立要契方可隨情。』
translation: The younger sister said, 'Let's make an agreement together so we can follow our hearts.'

source_sentence: 兄曰：『是何言要？』
translation: The elder brother said, 'What do you mean by an agreement?'

source_sentence: 妹曰：『若其證得殊勝果者，可來相見。』
translation: She said, 'If he has realized this excellent fruit, then he can come and meet us.'

source_sentence: 兄曰：『善哉！
translation: The brother said, 'Good!

source_sentence: 如汝所願。』
translation: As you wish.'

source_sentence: 即便辭去，至隱士所而為出家。
translation: He then left, went to the hermitage, and became a renunciant.

source_sentence: 由彼宿世善根力故，遂於三十七品菩提分法，無師自悟證獨覺果，便作是念：『我先與妹共立要契，今可往看。』
translation: Because of the strength of his good roots from previous lives, he realized for himself the fruit of pratyekabuddha without a teacher in the 37 factors of enlightenment, and then he thought, 'I've previously shared an essential agreement with my sister, so now I can go see it.'

source_sentence: 便至其所，上昇虛空身現神變，上出火光下流清水，奇相非一縱身而下。
translation: He then went to her place, ascended into the sky, and his body showed a miraculous transformation, emitting a sparkling light from above and flowing water from below, with a strange appearance that wasn't one single body falling down.

source_sentence: 諸凡夫人見神通時，心疾迴轉猶如大樹崩倒於地，頂禮尊足白言：『大兄！
translation: When ordinary ladies see that miraculous power, their minds quickly revert like a great tree crumbling to the ground, and they bow at the venerable's feet and say, 'Big brother!'

source_sentence: 今得如是殊妙勝德。』
translation: Now, I've attained this marvelous, excellent virtue.'

source_sentence: 答言：『我證。』
translation: He replied, 'I've realized it.'

source_sentence: 白言：『兄為資身須得食飲，我為求福願興供養，可住於此。』
translation: He said, 'Brother, I need food and drink to support myself, and I want to make offerings for the sake of good fortune, so I can stay here.'

source_sentence: 答曰：『汝無自在，可入報夫。』
translation: He replied, 'You don't have any freedom, so you can enter the rewarding husband.'

source_sentence: 即白夫言：『仁今知不？
translation: He then said to the man, 'Do you know now, sir?'

source_sentence: 我兄出家，成就禁戒，得上妙果，世間第一。
translation: My brother left home, fulfilled the precepts, and attained a marvelous result that's the best in the world.

source_sentence: 我欲供養不敢自專，若見許者於三月中飲食資給。』
translation: I want to make offerings, but I dare not lay claim to them. If I see permission, I'll give you food and drink for three months.'

source_sentence: 答言：『賢首！
translation: He replied, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 彼不出家，我雖不欲，終須供濟；況已出家獲殊勝道，今隨汝意供養三月。』
translation: Even though I don't want to help them if they don't leave home, I must still offer support, even if I have already left home and attained the excellent path. Now, I will follow your wishes and offer support for three months.'

source_sentence: 其夫更有一婦，見施飲食便作是念：『家財共有，彼既求福，我何不為？』
translation: Her husband also had a woman who saw the food and drink offered and thought, 'The family's wealth is shared, so why don't I do this for them?'

source_sentence: 告曰：『汝兄亦是我尊，我欲隔日而申供養。』
translation: He said, 'Your brother is also my venerable, and I want to make offerings to him every other day.'

source_sentence: 答言：『隨意。』
translation: She replied, 'As you like.'

source_sentence: 其獨覺妹護彼情故，妙食置內麁食覆上，持告舊妻：『我此飲食供養於兄，願當隨喜。』
translation: The solitary realizer's sister protected her feelings by placing a cup of crude food inside and covering it with crude food, and she told her old wife, 'I'm offering this food to my brother, and I hope you'll be pleased with it.'

source_sentence: 其時舊妻至設食日，亦護彼情，麁食置內精者覆上，持告新妻：『我此妙食奉施尊兄，願當隨喜。』
translation: When her old wife arrives to set up the meal, she also protects her feelings, placing the coarse food on top of the fine food inside, and she tells her new wife, 'I'll serve this wonderful food to my venerable brother, and I hope you'll be pleased with it.'

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻當知：勝鬘是獨覺妹，以精妙食供養兄故，由斯福力五百生中身常細軟。
translation: You monks should know that Śrīmālā is the uniquely enlightened sister who, because of the fine food she offers her brother, will always have a fine body for five hundred lifetimes because of that merit.

source_sentence: 其第二妻以外妙食施獨覺者，今行雨是，由斯業故五百生中容儀端正，乃至今生儀貌超絕。
translation: Her second wife gives exquisite food to the pratyekabuddha, and she now conducts herself in such a way that her conduct is correct for five hundred lifetimes and her appearance is superb in this lifetime.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻當知：黑業得黑報，白業得白報，雜業得雜報。
translation: You monks should know this: black actions obtain black rewards, white actions obtain white rewards, and mixed actions obtain mixed rewards.

source_sentence: 汝等應捨黑雜二業、修行白業，廣說如上。
translation: You should abandon both black and mixed actions and cultivate white actions, as explained in detail above.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻當如是學。」
translation: You monks should train yourselves in this way."

source_sentence: 復於後時勝鬘夫人遂便懷妊，同於此夜大臣婆羅門婦亦即有娠，由有娠故極受辛苦。
translation: It was then that Lady Śrīmālā became pregnant, and at the same time, the minister Brahman woman also became pregnant and suffered great hardship because of her pregnancy.

source_sentence: 勝鬘夫人至九月滿便誕一男，容貌端嚴人所樂見，經三七日聚會宗親，欲為其兒施立名字，王曰：「可抱此兒，將現國大夫人請立何字？」
translation: When the ninth month was complete, she gave birth to a boy whose appearance was beautiful and pleasing to everyone. After three or seven days, she gathered with her clan to name him, and the king said, "May I take this boy and ask the great lady of the present country to name him?"

source_sentence: 群臣如勅抱現夫人，時大夫人謂諸臣曰：「我豈先時不作是語：『觀斯婢女身形美觸，必當喪我憍薩羅城。』」
translation: When the ministers had thus commanded, the First Lady addressed the ministers, "Did I not say this before, 'Look at the beautiful body and touch of this maidservant; she will surely lose my city of Kośala?'"

source_sentence: 大臣白言：「誠有斯語，此子未生國大夫人先已為作不祥之記，應與此兒名為惡生。」
translation: The ministers said, "That's true, for before this child is born, the grand dame has already made an ominous prediction that this child will be called a bad birth."

source_sentence: 初生之日大臣之婦亦誕一男，生既滿月如上廣說，乃至總集諸親與兒立字，眾人議曰：「初懷此子母受艱辛，及至生時還遭極苦，宜與此兒名為苦母。」
translation: On the day of the first birth, the minister's wife also gave birth to a boy, and after the full moon of birth, as was explained in detail above, she even gathered her relatives together to give the boy a name, and the people discussed it, saying, "This son was first conceived by a mother who endured hardship and suffered great pain when he was born, so it would be appropriate to name this child 'Mother of Suffering.'"

source_sentence: 惡生太子以八養母而為供侍，廣如餘說。
translation: The unborn prince had eight nurturing mothers to serve, as explained in detail here.

source_sentence: 其苦母孩兒亦八養母而為供給，乃至長大。
translation: That suffering mother's child also had eight nurturing mothers to serve until he grew up.

source_sentence: 其婆羅門種種業藝無不學盡，後於異時，惡生太子與苦母等出城遊獵，太子乘馬忽爾奔馳，遂至劫比羅城到釋迦園所，其守園人遂告園主：「惡生太子今至園中。」
translation: There were no kinds of karmic skills that those brāhmaṇas hadn't learned in their entirety. At another time, the prince of misfortune and his mother of suffering were out hunting in the city when the prince suddenly rode his horse and galloped off to the city of Kapilavastu and reached the Śākyamuni's garden, and the park keeper then told the park manager, "The prince of misfortune has now arrived in the garden."

source_sentence: 釋子聞已互相議曰：「我等速出，欲殺惡生今正是時。」
translation: After the Śākyas heard this, they discussed it with each other, saying, "Let's quickly go out and try to kill that miserable being. Now is the right time."

source_sentence: 諸人各各嚴整兵甲即欲出城，耆老見之共相問曰：「汝等持兵欲向何處？」
translation: Each of them geared up their armor and prepared to leave the city, but when the elders saw them, they all asked, "Where do you want to go with your troops?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「惡生太子來在釋園。」
translation: He replied, "The prince of misfortune came to stay at Śākyamuni's garden."

source_sentence: 耆老曰：「彼是客人創來至此，未相觸悞今且容忍。」
translation: The elder said, "He's a guest who came here uninvited and has yet to make contact with us, so now we'll tolerate him."

source_sentence: 諸人聞已皆退入城。
translation: After they heard this, they all retreated into the city.

source_sentence: 於後四兵尋覓太子還到園中，於其園內周遊而住。
translation: The four soldiers then searched for the prince and returned to the garden, where they wandered around and stayed there.

source_sentence: 其守園人復報城人：「惡生四兵來入園內破散非分。」
translation: The park guard again reported to the people of the city, "The four soldiers of misfortune came into the park and broke up the wrong part."

source_sentence: 諸人聞已倍增瞋怒，更加威武咸共出城意欲殺戮。
translation: When the people heard that, they became even angrier and more formidable, and they all left the city with the intention of killing him.

source_sentence: 耆老復問：「汝等更向何處？」
translation: The elder then asked, "Where will you go from here?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「惡生太子乃領四兵，破損我園今欲殺戮。」
translation: He answered, "The prince of misfortune has led four armies to destroy our park and now wants to kill them."

source_sentence: 耆老曰：「且當容忍。」
translation: The elder said, "We must tolerate this."

source_sentence: 于時惡生知釋氏兵欲來相害，遂即引兵速歸本國，唯留一人告言：「住此，私聽釋子有何議論？」
translation: Knowing that the Śākyasin's troops were about to harm him, he led them back to his own country as quickly as possible, leaving only one person behind to tell him, "Stay here, and listen privately to what Śāriputra has to say."

source_sentence: 于時釋兵既至園所，追覓不得見彼一人，問曰：「婢子惡生今在何處？」
translation: When the army of the Śākyas arrived at the garden, they searched but couldn't find one of them, and asked, "Where is the handmaid's son, the evil one, now?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「尋即逃迸。」
translation: They replied, "Seeking is fleeing."

source_sentence: 時諸釋子作此議論：「我等若獲惡生身者，先須割手、或言截脚、或言剜心。
translation: The Śākyas then had this discussion, "If we were to attain the body of a bad being, we would first have to cut off our hands, or we would say, 'Cut off our legs,' or we would say, 'Cut out our hearts.'

source_sentence: 今既私逃更何所作？」
translation: Now that we've escaped uninvited, what else would we do?"

source_sentence: 遂令手力掘却惡生行住之地，深至于膝，別以餘土填滿其坑，所倚牆壁亦皆削去，別更泥塗水乳香湯，及諸花彩灑散園內。
translation: He then had the ground where the evil student was walking and staying dug up by hand-power to a depth of knee deep, filled the hole with additional earth, cut away the walls against which it was standing, and spread mud, water, milk, scented baths, and flowers and colors throughout the garden.

source_sentence: 作是事時，彼所留人皆悉具見，遂往憍薩羅城至惡生處，稽首作禮在一面立，惡生問曰：「釋子於我有何議論？」
translation: When he did this, they all saw what he had left behind, so he went to the city of Kośala, went to the evil student, paid homage by prostrating himself at one side, and the evil student asked, "What did Śāriputra say about me?"

source_sentence: 白言：「太子！
translation: Bai Yan: "Crown Prince!

source_sentence: 其言毒害，我不敢說。」
translation: Their words are so poisonous that I dare not speak of them."

source_sentence: 惡生曰：「彼出惡言令其自受，汝所聞見今可實說，我欲知彼所為之事。」
translation: The evil creature says, "They speak harsh words that cause them to suffer, and now you can truly explain what you've heard and seen; I want to know what they've done."

source_sentence: 彼人即為廣說如上。
translation: That person then explained it in detail as above.

source_sentence: 惡生聞已便懷忿恨，告左右曰：「汝等憶持！
translation: After hearing this, the evil being became angry and told his friends, "Remember this!

source_sentence: 父王歿後我紹位時，汝等當說斯事令我憶知，是我先怨必誅釋種。」
translation: When I assume the throne after my father's death, you will tell me this to remind me that this is my prior enemy who will surely punish the Śākya lineage."

source_sentence: 苦母曰：「善哉太子！
translation: The mother of suffering said, "Good, Prince!

source_sentence: 快出此語，願自堅心，紹位之時我當為說。」
translation: Quickly utter these words, vowing to firmly establish your mind, and I will explain them for you when you assume your position."

source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶雜事卷第七
translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya-kṣudraka-vastu, vol. 7
